39358369.review: Funny, Cute, and lots of fun.

39342615.review:
Become a goose and crush humanity.

A very pleasant, cute, experience. It has a lot of character, the story is fun, visuals pleasant to look at, the music is great and the game even features some neat mechanics later on.
It has many obvious parallels to Undertale, but it manages to create an atmosphere of it's own, and hell, it's free.

38278713.review: This is a good game. Not sure what to say about this one, have to play it for youself. Essentially, you take control of a purple goose and you have to do these puzzles on these computers as well as hide from the humans. Did I mention that it's free? But of course, you already knew that.

37706372.review:
Bom, tirando o fato desse game ser praticamente um clone de Undertale, eu até que me diverti em algumas partes. O estilo visual é, obviamente, inspirado (quase chupado) de Undertale, mas acaba tendo uma identidade própria no que diz respeito ao nonsense do game.
A estória não tem foco na complexidade ou no peso dramático, nem é tão inovadora quanto Undertale; no entanto, é ainda consideravelmente efetiva na sua premissa - fazer você dar uma risadinha com o humor aleatório do jogo, que, aliás, evolui muito com o seu lado dark e narrativa ambígua.
Como um game gratuíto e curtinho, eu acho que é uma experiência interessante, caso também estejam na curiosidade. A jogabilidade é extremamente diferente de Undertale, se vocês ainda estiverem receosos do System Goose Overload ser realmente apenas um clone. Há momentos em que ele brinca um pouco com os prórpios controles pra te dar um senso maior de desafio. A trilha sonora também é bem agradável. No geral, um bom passatempo.

35587071.review: A wonderful way to spend the afternoon! It’s a challenging (at least for me) and silly romp with geese. I would pay money for this if I could.

35554091.review: Very cute and charming game with that supreme undertale vibe. Really happy about this game and also great value, especially considering it's free. Totally worth the time. ♥

35482092.review: This game has changed my dewwino into a full grown darren

35200363.review:
For the price? Sure, why not! It's pretty quirky and strange, the art style is cute and consistent, the humor is here and there but I got a few good chuckles out of it at least. I am curious about all the 'secrets' though - I really didn't find anything in my playthrough that I'd imagine to be a proper secret, but there may have been some interactables and such that I really didn't pay much mind to in a sense, or screens I shoulda explored more thoroughly.

Still, though, pretty cute project for free and for a small team. Definite potential in the longer run for 'em.

Thanks for reading

34727510.review:
What did I just play? It's like the game is taking you on an acid trip, as you can tell by some of my screenshots.

I can't really go on an essay review here, but here we go...

System Goose Overload is free, hence why I gave it a try. I thought the art style was pretty impressive, especially for a free game. The sound and music get pretty interesting at times as well. The game is full of all sorts of tongue-in-cheek jokes and bizarre characters. Some people here reference Undertale, and maybe they're right on that part, though the game really is crazy.

For gameplay, it's overall simple. Honestly, "Adventure" and "RPG" are the game's tags, but they do not fit at all with what you do. You walk along as this weird purple goose, mostly through linear areas for a good while. You can talk to some characters and observe a bunch of objects as you go along. The characters are off-the-wall, and the game usually throws a bunch of puns or silly things when you observe something (again, see my screenshots, e.g., the ice tray). Sometimes I would laugh out loud, and sometimes I would just stare awkwardly at the screen.

Every so often, you hit save points and sections with obstacles. The majority of the obstacles are searchlights, where you can simply "hide" whenever they are over you. Thus, you have to time your movement with their movement. Occasionally, there are "hacking" minigames where you move through and again dodge a few spiky objects. Later in the game, you have some confusing mazes or puzzles to solve, along with new lights that flicker, or lasers that bounce around. But the premise generally remains the same: dodge moving obstacles, and find your way through.

You do learn a story as you go along, but again, it's completely unexpected and silly.

([i]EDIT: I had a downside here about typos in the game, but the creator said they are fixing them.[/i])

I'm not sure what to expect in the future, honestly. This was just so... out there...

34596449.review: Really fun free game with the humour of undertale and a bit of it's heart, eariness and overall feel, Now i love this game, is really weird and i love weird stuff,the art was really Well done and the music was really charming, i for some reason loved the diagonal movement animation it was really cute... As the game itself, give it a play and bring glory to goosekind once more
